answers.answer: I missed your post and by now you already had your appointment.Orthostatic hypotention is suspect as it is often linked to diabetes, but you can also look into underlying causes, like side effects of Alpha1 Blockers & certain antidepressants (not applicable to you), vitamin B12 methylocobalmin and/or vitamin D3 deficiency complications & leptin resistance causing hormonal dysregulation.Please let us know, how your doctor's appointment went.Best wishes.Niko

question: For the past 3-4 days I have been feeling extremely lightheaded. When in a sitting position, I feel a little bit foggy (fatigue) but whenever I stand up (especially after lying down or sitting for a long period of time) I get extremely dizzy, I lose my vision and my head aches. I also get nauseous for the next 15 minutes or so. I feel like my blood pressure is constantly low.I do have type 1 diabetes but have noticed my blood sugar levels are not low (occasionally have been slightly elevated but not high to cause hyperglycemia.) I don't smoke and I am not taking any other medications. I'm also not on my period.This is really abnormal for me and I'm quite concerned. I realize a visit to the doctor could benefit me but my appointment isn't until next week and I would like to know if anyone else had a diagnosis for a similar condition. Thanks!
title: Lightheaded for days
